body: Thanks @sahilTakiar . @liyinan926 can you review the rest?
Please have a separate PR with just the APIs.

@sahilTakiar can you review some logging changes to the sftp helper? For large files the log frequency is a lot now. I changed it to every 1000 iterations when the buffer is full. For a 100mb file it now logs ~5 times.
@liyinan926 if we want to make a `State` object in the `StateStore` mutable, should we not just add some more methods to the `StateStore` interface for modifying specific `State` objects?
can we rename the library gobblin-config or gobblin-config-management?
Most of the interfaces and methods need javadoc
LGTM other than the minor comment.
LGTM other than the minor comment.
@liyinan926 please take another look. I have added some unit tests for data writer.
Updated. Using `SchemaRegistryException` for all methods in `KafkaSchemaRegistry` which should be thrown upon any failure.
I looked at all the API classes, are other classes ready?
LGTM other than the minor formatting comments.

Can we move all processing of the applicationId (storing, reading, deleting the applicationId) behind an interface. That way we can change out where the applicationId is stored in the future. For example, we may decide that instead of storing the applicationId in a file on HDFS, we want to store the applicationid in Zookeeper.
@liyinan926 addressed pr comments please take a look
LGTM, can you squash the commits?
Seems java 8 build is consistently failing.

Synced up with @ibuenros. We realized since the file storing the application ID is under a directory named after the application name, if it happens to have two instances from the same user with the same application name (maybe by mistake), the two instances will try updating the same file. So storing the application ID offers no real benefit over simply using the application name to match the application. So I'm gonna remove `ApplicationIdStore` and `FsApplicationIdStore` and rely on application name.
Seems the build is failing on both Java 7 and 8. Have you tested building this locally?
Seems the build failed since `gobblin-yarn` will only be included if `-PuseHadoop2` is used. Finding a way to fix this.
@zliu41 Fixed several bugs during test. Can you review?
Updated with some fix. Tested in Azkaban with regular compaction, late data movement, and recompaction.

Hey @kalyancv it seems that there are a few unnecessary binary files in your Pull Request. Could you remove them? Specifically referring to the ones under `gobblin-rest-service`.

Also, the new classes you have written are under `gobblin-example`, can you move them to `gobblin-core`?

Hey @sahilTakiar, I am doing these changes. Once this code is bug free and running correctly I'll move it to gobbline-core and raise a pull request. Fo ther time being you can close this pull request because it's still a work in progress.

Since the mapper will fail if there's an incompatible schema, can you print the file paths that cause problems in the mapper, like `throw new IOException("Unable to process paths " + ((CombineFileSplit) context.getInputSplit()).getPaths(), e);`
Because the Avro exception message doesn't contain the file path, which can be annoying to debug.
